Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Gunshot \Gun"shot`\, n. 1. Act of firing a gun; a shot. [1913 Webster]
2. The distance to which shot can be thrown from a gun, so as to be effective; the reach or range of a gun. [1913 Webster]
Those who are come over to the royal party are supposed to be out of gunshot. --Dryden. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Gunshot \Gun"shot`\, a. Made by the shot of a gun: as. a gunshot wound. [1913 Webster]
gunshot n : the act of shooting a gun; "the gunfire endangered innocent bystanders"; "they retreated in the face of withering enemy fire" [syn: {gunfire}]
